cards.name: Skeletal Grimace
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has "{B}: Regenerate this creature."
cards.flavor:
"And then I realized we all have skeletons on the inside. Why wait until the bodies are dead to control them?"
—Jadar, ghoulcaller of Nephalia
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has "{B}: Regenerate this creature."

cards.name: Skirsdag High Priest
cards.text: Morbid — {T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Create a 5/5 black Demon creature token with flying. Activate this ability only if a creature died this turn.
cards.flavor: "Thraben's pleas fall on deaf ears. Ours do not."

rulings.text: Unlike Skirsdag High Priest itself, the two other creatures you tap to activate the ability aren't required to have been under your control continuously since the beginning of your most recent turn.

cards.originalText: Morbid — {T}, Tap two untapped creatures you control: Put a 5/5 black Demon creature token with flying onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Stromkirk Patrol
cards.text: Whenever Stromkirk Patrol deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: "You'd best move along, human. Our palates are far less discerning than our master's."
cards.originalText: Whenever Stromkirk Patrol deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Tribute to Hunger
cards.text: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.
cards.flavor: Marella was delighted. The ball had attracted so many suitors for her daughter, including that handsome stranger. She wondered where the two were now . . . .

rulings.text: The amount of life you gain is equal to the creature's toughness as it last existed on the battlefield.

cards.originalText: Target opponent sacrifices a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

cards.name: Typhoid Rats
cards.text: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Kidnappers caught in Havengul are given two choices: languish in prison or become rat catchers. The smart ones go to prison.
cards.originalText: Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Unbreathing Horde
cards.text:
Unbreathing Horde enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each other Zombie you control and each Zombie card in your graveyard.
If Unbreathing Horde would be dealt damage, prevent that damage and remove a +1/+1 counter from it.

rulings.text: Only one +1/+1 counter will be removed, no matter how much damage is prevented.
If Unbreathing Horde has no +1/+1 counters on it (but its toughness is raised above 0 by another effect), any damage dealt to it will still be prevented, even though no counter will be removed.
If Unbreathing Horde enters the battlefield from a graveyard, it will count itself when determining how many +1/+1 counters it enters the battlefield with.

cards.originalText:
Unbreathing Horde enters the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter on it for each other Zombie you control and each Zombie card in your graveyard.
If Unbreathing Horde would be dealt damage, prevent that damage and remove a +1/+1 counter from it.

cards.name: Unburial Rites
cards.text:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Flashback {3}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: All crave the Blessed Sleep. Few receive it.
cards.originalText:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
Flashback {3}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Vampire Interloper
cards.text:
Flying
Vampire Interloper can't block.
cards.flavor: He listens to every heartbeat, deciding which one of hundreds he will stop.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Vampire Interloper can't block.

cards.name: Victim of Night
cards.text: Destroy target non-Vampire, non-Werewolf, non-Zombie creature.
cards.flavor:
"Do not touch a drop. Not yet. I want to watch this so-called slayer's last crisis of faith."
—Olivia Voldaren
cards.originalText: Destroy target non-Vampire, non-Werewolf, non-Zombie creature.

cards.name: Village Cannibals
cards.text: Whenever another Human creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Village Cannibals.
cards.flavor: Some have endured the horrors of Innistrad by becoming the worst monsters of all.
cards.originalText: Whenever another Human creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Village Cannibals.

cards.name: Walking Corpse
cards.flavor:
"Is it hopeless? When wave upon wave of our dead return as mindless flesh-eaters to claw upon Thraben's walls? We're too busy cutting them down to indulge ourselves in such philosophical foppery."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

cards.name: Ancient Grudge
cards.text:
Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: If there's anything a werewolf hates, it's a collar—especially Avacyn's Collar, the symbol of her church.
cards.originalText:
Destroy target artifact.
Flashback {G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Ashmouth Hound
cards.text: Whenever Ashmouth Hound blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Ashmouth Hound deals 1 damage to that creature.
cards.flavor: Its fiery paws make it easy to track, which is very useful when you want to go in exactly the opposite direction.

rulings.text: Ashmouth Hound's ability triggers once for each creature it blocks or becomes blocked by.

cards.originalText: Whenever Ashmouth Hound blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Ashmouth Hound deals 1 damage to that creature.

cards.name: Balefire Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Balefire Dragon deals combat damage to a player, it deals that much damage to each creature that player controls.
cards.flavor: If it comes for you, die boldly or die swiftly—for die you will.

rulings.text: The damage dealt by Balefire Dragon's triggered ability isn't combat damage.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Whenever Balefire Dragon deals combat damage to a player, it deals that much damage to each creature that player controls.

cards.name: Blasphemous Act
cards.text:
This spell costs {1} less to cast for each creature on the battlefield.
Blasphemous Act deals 13 damage to each creature.
cards.flavor:
"Holy places are no longer sanctuary from death, and death is no longer sanctuary from anything."
—Thalia, Knight-Cathar

rulings.text: The total cost to cast Blasphemous Act is locked in before you pay that cost. For example, if there are three creatures on the battlefield, including one you can sacrifice to add {C} to your mana pool, the total cost of Blasphemous Act is {5}{R}. Then you can sacrifice the creature when you activate mana abilities just before paying the cost.
Blasphemous Act's ability can't reduce the total cost to cast the spell below {R}.
Although players may respond to Blasphemous Act once it's been cast, once it's announced, they can't respond before the cost is calculated and paid.

cards.originalText:
Blasphemous Act costs {1} less to cast for each creature on the battlefield.
Blasphemous Act deals 13 damage to each creature.

cards.name: Bloodcrazed Neonate
cards.text:
Bloodcrazed Neonate attacks each combat if able.
Whenever Bloodcrazed Neonate deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: While elder vampires select their meals with care, the newly sired frenzy at the first whiff.
cards.originalText:
Bloodcrazed Neonate attacks each turn if able.
Whenever Bloodcrazed Neonate deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Brimstone Volley
cards.text:
Brimstone Volley deals 3 damage to any target.
Morbid — Brimstone Volley deals 5 damage to that permanent or player instead if a creature died this turn.
cards.originalText:
Brimstone Volley deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
Morbid — Brimstone Volley deals 5 damage to that creature or player instead if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Burning Vengeance
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: Mist is the geists' sorrow. Wind is their pain. Fire is their vengeance.

rulings.text: Although flashback and retrace are the most common ways to cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance will trigger whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard through any means.
Burning Vengeance doesn't trigger when you activate an ability of a card in your graveyard, such as unearth or the ability of Reassembling Skeleton.
Burning Vengeance's triggered ability will resolve before the spell you cast from your graveyard.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a spell from your graveyard, Burning Vengeance deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Charmbreaker Devils
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, return an instant or sorcery card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Charmbreaker Devils gets +4/+0 until end of turn.

rulings.text: The instant or sorcery card returned to your hand is chosen at random as Charmbreaker Devils's first ability resolves. If any player responds to the ability, that player won't yet know what card will be returned.
Because the first ability doesn't target the instant or sorcery card, any instants or sorceries put into your graveyard in response to that ability may be returned to your hand.
All players get to see which card you chose at random as it's returned to your hand.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, return an instant or sorcery card at random from your graveyard to your hand.
Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell, Charmbreaker Devils gets +4/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Crossway Vampire
cards.text: When Crossway Vampire enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: "Do not flatter Fate. It did not guide you into my clutches tonight. That was all my doing."
cards.originalText: When Crossway Vampire enters the battlefield, target creature can't block this turn.

cards.name: Curse of Stalked Prey
cards.text:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to enchanted player, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.
cards.flavor:
"Innocent thorns can fill the air with your bloodscent. Don't stray from the path."
—Elmut, crossway watcher

rulings.text: The ability will trigger when any creature deals combat damage to the enchanted player, including one controlled by another opponent or even by the enchanted player (if combat damage gets redirected somehow).

cards.originalText:
Enchant player
Whenever a creature deals combat damage to enchanted player, put a +1/+1 counter on that creature.

cards.name: Curse of the Nightly Hunt
cards.text:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls attack each combat if able.
cards.flavor: When the moon rises and the bloodlust takes hold, nothing matters but the kill.

rulings.text: The enchanted player still chooses which player or planeswalker each creature they control attacks.

If, during the enchanted player's declare attackers step, a creature they control is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having the creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText:
Enchant player
Creatures enchanted player controls attack each turn if able.

cards.name: Curse of the Pierced Heart
cards.text:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of the Pierced Heart deals 1 damage to that player or a planeswalker that player controls.
cards.flavor:
"May your veins weep, and may every vampire take notice."
—Stensian curse
cards.originalText:
Enchant player
At the beginning of enchanted player's upkeep, Curse of the Pierced Heart deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Desperate Ravings
cards.text:
Draw two cards, then discard a card at random.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: Her mind was quite gone, yet she spoke nothing but truth.

rulings.text: You draw two cards and discard one randomly all while Desperate Ravings is resolving. Nothing can happen between the two, and no player may choose to take actions.

cards.originalText:
Draw two cards, then discard a card at random.
Flashback {2}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Devil's Play
cards.text:
Devil's Play deals X damage to any target.
Flashback {X}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: A devil's hands are never idle.
cards.originalText:
Devil's Play deals X damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {X}{R}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Falkenrath Marauders
cards.text:
Flying, haste
Whenever Falkenrath Marauders deals combat damage to a player, put two +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.flavor: No slinking in the dark for them, no luring whispers. They claim their prey in the speed and glory of the hunt.

foreignNames.name: ファルケンラスの匪賊

cards.originalText:
Flying, haste
Whenever Falkenrath Marauders deals combat damage to a player, put two +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Feral Ridgewolf
cards.text:
Trample
{1}{R}: Feral Ridgewolf gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The wolves no longer hunt just to feed. They kill for sport, or for some madness behind their eyes."
—Elmut, crossway watcher
cards.originalText:
Trample
{1}{R}: Feral Ridgewolf gets +2/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Furor of the Bitten
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each combat if able.
cards.flavor: Those who only believe themselves infected with lycanthropy can be as dangerous as those who really are.

rulings.text: The enchanted creature's controller still chooses which player or planeswalker that creature attacks.

If, during its controller's declare attackers step, the enchanted creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or hasn't been under that player's control continuously since the turn began (and doesn't have haste), then it doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having the creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't have to attack in that case either.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 and attacks each turn if able.

cards.name: Geistflame
cards.text:
Geistflame deals 1 damage to any target.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: Innistrad pyromancers find their best raw materials in the fury of the dead.
cards.originalText:
Geistflame deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Hanweir Watchkeep
cards.text:
Defender
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hanweir Watchkeep.
cards.flavor: He scans for wolves, knowing there's one he can never anticipate.

rulings.text: For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

foreignNames.name: ハンウィアーの砦守り

cards.originalText:
Defender
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Hanweir Watchkeep.

cards.name: Bane of Hanweir
cards.text:
Bane of Hanweir attacks each combat if able.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Bane of Hanweir.
cards.flavor: Technically he never left his post. He looks after the wolf wherever it goes.
cards.originalText:
Bane of Hanweir attacks each turn if able.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Bane of Hanweir.

cards.name: Harvest Pyre
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, exile X cards from your graveyard.
Harvest Pyre deals X damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: Corpses destroyed by fire form the most destructive geists.
cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Harvest Pyre, exile X cards from your graveyard.
Harvest Pyre deals X damage to target creature.

cards.name: Heretic's Punishment
cards.text: {3}{R}: Choose any target, then put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard. Heretic's Punishment deals damage to that permanent or player equal to the highest converted mana cost among those cards.

rulings.text: If the targeted permanent or player is an illegal target by the time the ability resolves, the entire ability won't resolve. No cards will be put into your graveyard, and no damage will be dealt.

If you have two or fewer cards in your library when the ability resolves, all of them will be put into your graveyard. Heretic's Punishment will still deal damage equal to the highest converted mana cost among those cards.
The converted mana cost of a double-faced card in your graveyard is the converted mana cost of the front face.
If all three cards have a converted mana cost of 0, no damage will be dealt.

cards.originalText: {3}{R}: Choose target creature or player, then put the top three cards of your library into your graveyard.  Heretic's Punishment deals damage to that creature or player equal to the highest converted mana cost among those cards.

cards.name: Infernal Plunge
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Add {R}{R}{R}.
cards.flavor: "Oh mighty Griselbrand, Scourge of the Heedless World, gladly I consume myself for thee!"

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.originalText:
As an additional cost to cast Infernal Plunge, sacrifice a creature.
Add {R}{R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Instigator Gang
cards.text:
Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Instigator Gang.

rulings.text: For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

cards.originalText:
Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Instigator Gang.

cards.name: Wildblood Pack
cards.text:
Trample
Attacking creatures you control get +3/+0.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Wildblood Pack.
cards.originalText:
Trample
Attacking creatures you control get +3/+0.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Wildblood Pack.

cards.name: Into the Maw of Hell
cards.text: Destroy target land. Into the Maw of Hell deals 13 damage to target creature.
cards.flavor: Few entrances lead to where demons and devils lurk. Unfortunately, they occasionally open new ones.

rulings.text: Into the Maw of Hell targets both the land and the creature. You can only cast it if you can choose a legal target for both.

If one of Into the Maw of Hell's targets is illegal by the time it resolves, Into the Maw of Hell will still affect the remaining legal target. If both targets are illegal at this time, Into the Maw of Hell won't resolve.

cards.originalText: Destroy target land. Into the Maw of Hell deals 13 damage to target creature.

cards.name: Kessig Wolf
cards.text: {1}{R}: Kessig Wolf gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Don't be afraid when you hear the wolves howl. Be afraid when you don't hear them at all."
—Saint Trogen, the Slayer
cards.originalText: {1}{R}: Kessig Wolf gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Kruin Outlaw
cards.text:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Kruin Outlaw.
cards.flavor: "Hold tight. I've got a surprise for them."

rulings.text: If Kruin Outlaw somehow transforms after blockers have been declared but before combat ends, any Werewolves you control that are blocked by a single creature will remain blocked.
For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

cards.originalText:
First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Kruin Outlaw.

cards.name: Terror of Kruin Pass
cards.text:
Double strike
Werewolves you control have menace. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Terror of Kruin Pass.
cards.originalText:
Double strike
Each Werewolf you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Terror of Kruin Pass.

cards.name: Night Revelers
cards.text: Night Revelers has haste as long as an opponent controls a Human.
cards.flavor: Vampires think of themselves as the indisputable nobility of Innistrad, able to do as they please. There are few who can prove them wrong.
cards.originalText: Night Revelers has haste as long as an opponent controls a Human.

cards.name: Nightbird's Clutches
cards.text:
Up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: Shiny polished silver can ward off many creatures, but it attracts others.
cards.originalText:
Up to two target creatures can't block this turn.
Flashback {3}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Past in Flames
cards.text:
Each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: Only instant and sorcery cards in your graveyard when Past in Flames resolves will gain flashback. Instant and sorcery cards that are put into your graveyard later in the turn, including the resolving Past in Flames, won't gain flashback.
If you cast an instant or sorcery with {X} in its mana cost this way, you still choose the value of X as part of casting the spell and pay that cost.
If an instant or sorcery card in your graveyard already has flashback, you may use either flashback ability to cast it from your graveyard.
You may pay any optional additional costs the spell has, such as conspire costs. You must pay any mandatory additional costs the spell has, such as that of Bone Splinters.
For split cards, the flashback cost you pay is determined by the half you cast

cards.originalText:
Each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard gains flashback until end of turn. The flashback cost is equal to its mana cost.
Flashback {4}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Pitchburn Devils
cards.text: When Pitchburn Devils dies, it deals 3 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: The ingenuity of goblins, the depravity of demons, and the smarts of sheep.
cards.originalText: When Pitchburn Devils dies, it deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Rage Thrower
cards.text: Whenever another creature dies, Rage Thrower deals 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.
cards.flavor: "Some lament these haunted times, but I'm a geistflame-tank-half-full kind of person."

rulings.text: If Rage Thrower dies at the same time as another creature, its ability will trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature dies, Rage Thrower deals 2 damage to target player.

cards.name: Rakish Heir
cards.text: Whenever a Vampire you control deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: "If you're not having fun, what's the point of living forever?"
cards.originalText: Whenever a Vampire you control deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Reckless Waif
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Reckless Waif.
cards.flavor: "Yes, I'm alone. No, I'm not worried."

rulings.text: For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Reckless Waif.

cards.name: Merciless Predator
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Merciless Predator.
cards.flavor: Before she just wanted to snatch your purse; now she'll take the whole arm.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Merciless Predator.

cards.name: Riot Devils
cards.flavor: Devils are demons' unearthly desires made flesh. Let loose on the world, they satisfy their mad craving for destruction in a whirlwind of chaos.

cards.name: Rolling Temblor
cards.text:
Rolling Temblor deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
Flashback {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: When demons open a path to your front door, it's time to move.
cards.originalText:
Rolling Temblor deals 2 damage to each creature without flying.
Flashback {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Scourge of Geier Reach
cards.text: Scourge of Geier Reach gets +1/+1 for each creature your opponents control.
cards.flavor: Stensian villagers mourned the loss of human life. Thraben vampire slayers mourned the loss of living wood.

foreignNames.name: Plaie de la Chaîne de Geier

cards.originalText: Scourge of Geier Reach gets +1/+1 for each creature your opponents control.

cards.name: Skirsdag Cultist
cards.text: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skirsdag Cultist deals 2 damage to any target.
cards.flavor: "Within blood is life. Within life is fire. Within fire is the path to our masters' glory!"
cards.originalText: {R}, {T}, Sacrifice a creature: Skirsdag Cultist deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Stromkirk Noble
cards.text:
Stromkirk Noble can't be blocked by Humans.
Whenever Stromkirk Noble deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: "A responsible king walks among his subjects."
cards.originalText:
Stromkirk Noble can't be blocked by Humans.
Whenever Stromkirk Noble deals combat damage to a player, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Tormented Pariah
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Tormented Pariah.
cards.flavor: "Hey lads, the moon's rising. All the better to watch him beg for mercy."

rulings.text: For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Tormented Pariah.

cards.name: Rampaging Werewolf
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Rampaging Werewolf.
cards.flavor: "Just look at him, groveling on all fours! What a pathetic—uh-oh."
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Rampaging Werewolf.

cards.name: Traitorous Blood
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains trample and haste until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"I can make you dance to my tune like a puppet, your very blood eager to obey."
—Olivia Voldaren

rulings.text: Traitorous Blood can target any creature, even one that's tapped or one you already control.
Gaining control of a creature doesn't cause you gain control of any Auras or Equipment attached to it.

cards.originalText: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap it. It gains trample and haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Vampiric Fury
cards.text: Vampire creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Many peasants secretly admire vampires' glamour and elegance—until they witness a moment of pure bloodlust.

rulings.text: Only Vampires you control when Vampiric Fury resolves will receive the bonus. Creatures that enter the battlefield, that you gain control of later in the turn, or that become Vampires later in the turn won't be affected.

cards.originalText: Vampire creatures you control get +2/+0 and gain first strike until end of turn.

First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Village Ironsmith.
cards.flavor: Each night, he abandons the trappings of civilization.

First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Village Ironsmith.

First strike
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Ironfang.

First strike

Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor:

Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Avacyn's Pilgrim
cards.text: {T}: Add {W}.
cards.flavor: "Avacyn's protection is everywhere. From the holy church to the sacred glade, all that we see is under her blessed watch."
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Boneyard Wurm
cards.text: Boneyard Wurm's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: The only thing it likes more than discovering a pit of bones is adding to it.

rulings.text: The ability that defines Boneyard Wurm's power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield. If Boneyard Wurm is in your graveyard, it will count itself.

cards.originalText: Boneyard Wurm's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Bramblecrush
cards.text: Destroy target noncreature permanent.
cards.flavor:
"Civilization is fertilizer."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.originalText: Destroy target noncreature permanent.

cards.name: Caravan Vigil
cards.text:
Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
Morbid — You may put that card onto the battlefield instead of putting it into your hand if a creature died this turn.

rulings.text: You can choose to put the basic land card into your hand even if a creature died the turn you cast Caravan Vigil.

cards.originalText:
Search your library for a basic land card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
Morbid — You may put that card onto the battlefield instead of putting it into your hand if a creature died this turn.

Flashback {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: The permanent types are artifact, creature, enchantment, land, and planeswalker.

Choose a permanent type. Return all cards of the chosen type from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Darkthicket Wolf
cards.text: {2}{G}: Darkthicket Wolf gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: Werewolf slayers don't know for certain how werewolves are created. So they kill all the wolves, just to be safe.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}: Darkthicket Wolf gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Elder of Laurels
cards.text: {3}{G}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.
cards.flavor: Hopes and prayers can carry the same force as swords and torches.

rulings.text: The number of creatures you control is counted as the ability resolves.
Once the ability has resolved, the bonus won't change if the number of creatures you control changes later in the turn.

cards.originalText: {3}{G}: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creatures you control.

cards.name: Essence of the Wild
cards.text: Creatures you control enter the battlefield as a copy of Essence of the Wild.
cards.flavor: Wander too far into the wild and it may take you for its own.

rulings.text: Creatures you control don't copy whether Essence of the Wild is tapped or untapped, whether it has any counters on it or any Auras and Equipment attached to it, or any non-copy effects that have changed its power, toughness, types, color, or so on.
Because creatures you control enter the battlefield as a copy of Essence of the Wild, any enters-the-battlefield triggered abilities printed on such creatures won't trigger.

Replacement effects that modify how a creature enters the battlefield are applied in the following order: first control-changing effects (such as Gather Specimens), then copy effects (such as the abilities of Essence of the Wild and Clone), then all other effects. This is a minor rules change to make Essence of the Wild and similar cards in the future work intuitively.

If a creature such as Clone is entering the battlefield under your control, there will be two copy effects to apply: the creature's own and Essence of the Wild's. No matter what order these effects are applied, the creature will be a copy of Essence of the Wild when it enters the battlefield.

Other enters-the-battlefield replacement abilities printed on the creature entering the battlefield won't be applied because the creature will already be Essence of the Wild at that point (and therefore it won't have those abilities). For example, a creature that normally enters the battlefield tapped will enter the battlefield as an untapped Essence of the Wild, and a creature that would normally enter the battlefield with counters on it will enter the battlefield as an Essence of the Wild with no counters.

External abilities may still affect how a creature enters the battlefield. For example, if your opponent controls Urabrask the Hidden, which reads, in part, "Creatures your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped," a creature entering the battlefield under your control will be a tapped Essence of the Wild.

If a creature such as Cryptoplasm that's already on the battlefield copies Essence of the Wild and modifies its own copy effect, that modification is also copied by creatures entering the battlefield under your control.
If you control more than one Essence of the Wild, creatures you control will enter the battlefield as a copy of the one whose copy effect you apply last.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control enter the battlefield as a copy of Essence of the Wild.

cards.name: Festerhide Boar
cards.text:
Trample
Morbid — Festerhide Boar enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Bury your dead deep. The boars are hungriest while the corpse is still warm."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald
cards.originalText:
Trample
Morbid — Festerhide Boar enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Full Moon's Rise
cards.text:
Werewolf creatures you control get +1/+0 and have trample.
Sacrifice Full Moon's Rise: Regenerate all Werewolf creatures you control.
cards.flavor: Some lycanthropes wish they could abandon their weak human shapes and revel in the power of the wolf.

rulings.text: In order to regenerate Werewolves involved in combat, you must sacrifice Full Moon's Rise before combat damage is assigned. This means they will lose the +1/+0 and trample bonuses before combat damage assignment.

cards.originalText:
Werewolf creatures you control get +1/+0 and have trample.
Sacrifice Full Moon's Rise: Regenerate all Werewolf creatures you control.

cards.name: Garruk Relentless
cards.text:
When Garruk Relentless has two or fewer loyalty counters on him, transform him.
0: Garruk Relentless deals 3 damage to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to him.
0: Create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.

rulings.text: Garruk Relentless's first ability is a state-triggered ability. It triggers once Garruk has two or fewer loyalty counters on him and it can't retrigger while that ability is on the stack.
You don't add or remove loyalty counters from Garruk Relentless when he transforms into Garruk, the Veil-Cursed. In most cases, he'll have one or two loyalty counters on him.
You can't activate a loyalty ability of Garruk Relentless and later that turn after he transforms activate a loyalty ability of Garruk, the Veil-Cursed.
For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

cards.originalText:
When Garruk Relentless has two or fewer loyalty counters on him, transform him.
0: Garruk Relentless deals 3 damage to target creature. That creature deals damage equal to its power to him.
0: Put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Garruk, the Veil-Cursed
cards.text:
+1: Create a 1/1 black Wolf creature token with deathtouch.
−1: Sacrifice a creature. If you do, search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
−3: Creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

rulings.text: The second ability of Garruk, the Veil-Cursed doesn't target a creature. However, when that ability resolves, you must sacrifice a creature if you control one.

The number of creature cards in your graveyard is counted when the third ability of Garruk, the Veil-Cursed resolves. Once the ability resolves, the bonus doesn't change if that number changes later in the turn.

Only creatures you control when the third ability of Garruk, the Veil-Cursed resolves will receive the bonus. Creatures that enter the battlefield or that you gain control of later in the turn won't be affected.

-1: Sacrifice a creature. If you do, search your library for a creature card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
-3: Creatures you control gain trample and get +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of creature cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Krallenhorde Wantons
cards.text: At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Krallenhorde Wantons.
cards.flavor: The boot prints became paw prints, and they led right back into town.

cards.name: Gutter Grime
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, put a slime counter on Gutter Grime, then create a green Ooze creature token with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of slime counters on Gutter Grime."

rulings.text: The power and toughness of the Ooze tokens will constantly update as Gutter Grime accumulates slime counters.

If you control more than one Gutter Grime, each Ooze token remembers which one created it. The power and toughness of that Ooze will be equal to the number of slime counters on that Gutter Grime only.

If Gutter Grime leaves the battlefield, the power and toughness of each Ooze token it created will become 0. Unless another effect is raising its toughness above 0, each of these Ooze tokens will be put into its owner's graveyard the next time state-based actions are checked.

cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, put a slime counter on Gutter Grime, then put a green Ooze creature token onto the battlefield with "This creature's power and toughness are each equal to the number of slime counters on Gutter Grime."

cards.name: Hamlet Captain
cards.text: Whenever Hamlet Captain attacks or blocks, other Humans you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "I would fear this fight, bloodsucker, were I alone."
cards.originalText: Whenever Hamlet Captain attacks or blocks, other Human creatures you control get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hollowhenge Scavenger
cards.text: Morbid — When Hollowhenge Scavenger enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, you gain 5 life.
cards.flavor: After werewolves slaughtered the citizenry of Hollowhenge, other creatures moved in.

foreignNames.name: ホロウヘンジのゴミあさり

cards.originalText: Morbid — When Hollowhenge Scavenger enters the battlefield, if a creature died this turn, you gain 5 life.

cards.name: Kessig Cagebreakers
cards.text: Whenever Kessig Cagebreakers attacks, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token that's tapped and attacking for each creature card in your graveyard.
cards.flavor: "They put bars on these noble beasts and then wonder why werewolves target our towns."

rulings.text: You count the number of creature cards in your graveyard when the triggered ability resolves.
You declare which player or planeswalker each token is attacking as you put it onto the battlefield. It doesn't have to be the same player or planeswalker Kessig Cagebreakers is attacking.
Although the tokens are attacking, they were never declared as attacking creatures (for purposes of abilities that trigger whenever a creature attacks, for example).

cards.originalText: Whenever Kessig Cagebreakers attacks, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield tapped and attacking for each creature card in your graveyard.

cards.name: Kindercatch
cards.flavor: In the forest villages of Kessig, parents feed their children wormwood and other bitter herbs, hoping to make them less palatable to things that roam the night.

cards.name: Lumberknot
cards.text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Lumberknot.
cards.flavor: Animated by geists fused in its oak, it hungers for more life to add to its core.
cards.originalText:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever a creature dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Lumberknot.

cards.name: Make a Wish
cards.text: Return two cards at random from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: In Gavony wishing is taken as a sign of weakness, yet the wells usually brim with silver.

rulings.text: Make a Wish isn't put into its owner's graveyard until it is finished resolving, so it can't be returned by its own effect.
The cards aren't randomly chosen until Make a Wish resolves.
If you only have one card in your graveyard when Make a Wish resolves, that card will be returned to your hand.

cards.originalText: Return two cards at random from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.text:
Other Human creatures you control get +1/+1.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if no spells were cast last turn, transform Mayor of Avabruck.
cards.flavor: He can deny his true nature for only so long.

rulings.text: For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

cards.originalText:

cards.name: Howlpack Alpha
cards.text:
Each other creature you control that's a Werewolf or a Wolf gets +1/+1.
At the beginning of your end step, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Howlpack Alpha.

rulings.text: A creature that is both a Werewolf and a Wolf will only get +1/+1 from Howlpack Alpha.

cards.originalText:
Other Werewolf and Wolf creatures you control get +1/+1.
At the beginning of your end step, put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.
At the beginning of each upkeep, if a player cast two or more spells last turn, transform Howlpack Alpha.

cards.name: Moldgraf Monstrosity
cards.text:
Trample
When Moldgraf Monstrosity dies, exile it, then return two creature cards at random from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: The border between life and death is as thin as a layer of topsoil.

rulings.text: If Moldgraf Monstrosity's ability can't exile it (perhaps because it's not still in the graveyard when the ability resolves), the two creature cards are still returned to the battlefield.

If two Moldgraf Monstrosities die simultaneously, the first ability to resolve could return the other Moldgraf Monstrosity to the battlefield. If it does, the second Moldgraf Monstrosity's ability won't exile it but it will return two more creature cards to the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Trample
When Moldgraf Monstrosity dies, exile it, then return two creature cards at random from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.name: Moonmist
cards.text: Transform all Humans. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures other than Werewolves and Wolves. (Only double-faced cards can be transformed.)

rulings.text: Moonmist causes any double-faced Human to transform, not just Werewolves.
Whether or not a creature is a Werewolf or a Wolf is checked only as combat damage is dealt. If the creature isn't a Werewolf or a Wolf at that time, its combat damage will be prevented.
Moonmist will prevent combat damage dealt by a creature that isn't a Werewolf or a Wolf even if that creature wasn't on the battlefield (or was a Werewolf or a Wolf) when Moonmist resolved.

cards.originalText: Transform all Humans. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn by creatures other than Werewolves and Wolves. (Only double-faced cards can be transformed.)

cards.name: Mulch
cards.text: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: The land knows no difference between the graves of commoners and nobles.
cards.originalText: Reveal the top four cards of your library. Put all land cards revealed this way into your hand and the rest into your graveyard.

cards.name: Naturalize
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor:
"Stone and thought fade into ruin. Only the wind in the leaves will endure."
—Tomb inscription
cards.originalText: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Orchard Spirit
cards.text: Orchard Spirit can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.
cards.flavor:
"Pick not the rotten fruit, but neither touch the best. Leave those as an offering for our unseen guests."
—Radwick, farmer of Gatstaf
cards.originalText: Orchard Spirit can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.

cards.name: Parallel Lives
cards.text: If an effect would create one or more tokens under your control, it creates twice that many of those tokens instead.
cards.flavor:
"There will come a time when the only prey left will be each other."
—Ulrich of Krallenhorde Pack

rulings.text: All of the tokens enter the battlefield simultaneously. They'll have the same name, color, type and subtype, abilities, power, toughness, and so on.

If the effect is putting more than one kind of token onto the battlefield, it'll put twice as many of each kind onto the battlefield. For example, if you cast Bestial Menace while controlling Parallel Lives, you'll put two Snake tokens, two Wolf tokens, and two Elephant tokens onto the battlefield.

If you control two Parallel Lives, then the number of tokens created is four times the original number. If you control three, then the number of tokens created is eight times the original number, and so on.
If the effect creating the tokens instructs you to do something with those tokens at a later time, like exiling them at the end of combat, you'll do that for all the tokens.

cards.originalText: If an effect would put one or more tokens onto the battlefield under your control, it puts twice that many of those tokens onto the battlefield instead.

cards.name: Prey Upon
cards.text: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor:
"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

rulings.text: If either or both targets are illegal when Prey Upon tries to resolve, no creature will deal or be dealt damage.

cards.originalText: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.text: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor: In the remote corners of Kessig, protection is found in secret powers unknown to the Church of Avacyn.

foreignNames.name: レインジャーの悪知恵

cards.originalText: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 and gains hexproof until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.flavor: Stensian vampires encourage spiders near their manors so they can rob the webs.

cards.originalText:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Morbid — Somberwald Spider enters the battlefield with two +1/+1 counters on it if a creature died this turn.

cards.name: Spider Spawning
cards.text:
Create a 1/2 green Spider creature token with reach for each creature card in your graveyard.
Flashback {6}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

rulings.text: The number of creature cards in your graveyard is counted when Spider Spawning resolves.

cards.originalText:
Put a 1/2 green Spider creature token with reach onto the battlefield for each creature card in your graveyard.
Flashback {6}{B} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Spidery Grasp
cards.text: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+4 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"Nobody's seen the Lady of Videns for years. Poor dear, no companions at all in that old castle."
—Yonda of Gavony

rulings.text: Spidery Grasp can target a creature that's already untapped. It will still get +2/+4 and gain reach.

cards.originalText: Untap target creature. It gets +2/+4 and gains reach until end of turn. (It can block creatures with flying.)
